intro: Miconia neosecundiflora, commonly known as the Neosecond-flowering Miconia, is a member of the Melastomataceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of South America. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It produces small, round fruits that are dispersed by animals. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
